bibl.title: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Louis A. LaGarde, May 27, 1905

div1.p: Gorgas asks LaGarde, the superintendent of Ancon Hospital, to resign.

div1.head: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Louis A. LaGarde, May 27, 1905
div1.opener:
COPY
May 27, 1905.
Maj. Louis A. LaGarde,
Superintendent of Ancon Hospital,
Ancon, C.Z.
Dear LaGarde:-
div1.p:
After thinking over the matter for the past five months, I have
come to the conclusion that it is better for us both, you and me, and for the
Sanitary Department that your connection with it be severed.

At the same time I wish to act in the premises entirely without
prejudice to yourself, and, therefore, state to you in this letter my opinion
on the subject candidly, and for the reason that I thought you might prefer
to take the initiative and ask for your relief rather than to have me do so.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, W.C. Gorgas
Chief Sanitary Officer. Copy for Surgeon-General, Washington, D.C.
